meanings.definition: To continue or carry on with an activity or process
meanings.sent1: She will prog with her painting after dinner.
meanings.sent2: He likes to prog with his daily exercise routine.
meanings.sent3: The ants decided to prog with their march, even in the rain.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to prog slowly as they waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The river progged steadily towards the sea, never stopping.

meanings.definition: A person who supports or advocates for a cause or policy
meanings.sent1: She is a dedicated prog for animal rights.
meanings.sent2: The community came together to support the local progs.
meanings.sent3: The little girl dressed up as a prog for Halloween.
meanings.sent4: He was a silent but effective prog for change in the company.
meanings.sent5: The progs gathered outside the courthouse to protest peacefully.

meanings.sent1: They watched their favorite prog every evening.

meanings.definition: To train or teach someone in a particular skill or subject
meanings.sent1: He will prog the new employees on company policies.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys proging young children in reading and writing.
meanings.sent3: The coach decided to prog the team on advanced techniques.
